FILE: cm002710v11.0.txt
DYAD: USA-CHINA
RIVALRY: RIV98
DISPUTE(S): MID220 
RIVALRY: RIV99
DISPUTE(S): MID31 MID1650 
RIVALRY: RIV100
DISPUTE(S): MID2208 MID145 
RIVALRY: RIV10101
DISPUTE(S): MID633 MID634 MID51 MID2052 MID50 MID2035 MID2033 MID2032 MID53 MID2049 MID173 MID2002 MID1363 MID3361 MID1353 MID172 MID611 MID251 MID2929 MID1216 MID2936 MID2947 MID2948 MID4065 MID4064 MID4088 MID4336 MID4281 MID4280 

PS: 19170417-19490930 0.5 19491001-19720227 0.00 19720228-20180714 0.25 20180715-20209999 0.00

PS-UPDATE2020: This reverts back to a serious rivalry in 2017 as China becomes the primary strategic rival for the US at some point, and vice-versa. The so-called Asia pivot in grand strategy for the US in 2012-13 set the stage for this, but there was still hope that constructivement engagement would work with China. This hope was abandoned and one key is 20180715 when President Trump leveled major sanctions against China, most of which are still in place as of 2022. Other elements that make this a strategic rivalry include continuing Taiwan posturing and threats, disputes over the South China Sea, competition for allies in Africa, US deepening ties with Asian states, and military planning on both sides for Asian conflict.


PSNOTES: 

PS-LAST-CHANGED: 20220602
PS-LAST-CHECKED: 20220602


Territorial-Maritime-Boundary Issues Variables

Pre-1900 MIDs: MID220 

MID220 

TERRMID: MID220 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID220 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID220 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID220 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID220 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID220 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID220 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID220 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID220 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID220 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID220 from cm narrative, this involves the Tientsin Massacre which occurred on June 21, 1870. Chinese villagers attacked an orphanage run by Western Christian missionaries and killed several people. France, Italy, and US protested and threatened China by deploying warships to its coast. China apologized for the incident. Coded not civil war because this was an isolated incident of violence by villagers, not a militarized rebel group. 

CIVWARLINK: MID220 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID220 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID220 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID220 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID220 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID220 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID31 

TERRMID: MID31 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID31 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID31 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID31 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID31 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID31 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID31 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID31 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID31 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID31 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID31 from cm narrative, this is one of two MIDs connected to the Boxer Rebellion. Conservative opponents of reform in China gave support to anti-foreign and anti-Christian secret societies. In 1900, Boxers attacked Christians throughout the countryside, leading to intervention by several Western/foreign powers, who defeated China in a war. Coded civil war MID because Chinese support to secret groups militarized them and led to widespread violence against Western interests, leading to Western intervention. 

CIVWARLINK: MID31 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID31 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID31 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID31 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID31 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID31 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID1650 

TERRMID: MID1650 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID1650 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID1650 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID1650 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID1650 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID1650 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID1650 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID1650 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID1650 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID1650 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID1650 is a bilateral MID connected to the Boxer Rebellion. From cm narrative, anti-reform elements of the Chinese government provided support to anti-foreign and anti-Christian secret societies who then attacked foreign interests/holdings and Christian missionaries throughout the country. In response, the US deployed warships and invaded parts of China. Coded civil war MID because groups in China were militarized by government support, and the militarized civil conflict that resulted led to US intervention, triggering this MID. 

CIVWARLINK: MID1650 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID1650 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID1650 not a multilateral MID, and not connected to civil conflict outside of China.

COUPMID: MID1650 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID1650 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID1650 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID1650 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2208 

TERRMID: MID2208 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2208 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2208 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2208 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2208 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2208 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2208 from cm narrative, the Great Powers (Germany, Japan, France, UK, US, Italy, Russia) demanded that China remove mines it had placed in the Dagu Harbor, as that harbor provided access to a major Chinese river. Those countries jointly threatened China, triggering this MID. China exchanged naval fire with Japan as part of this incident. Coded not maritime because the maritime boundary was not disputed between China and US. The US was coercing China into allowing the US to engage in trade via Chinese resources, but the US was not making a claim on Chinese maritime boundaries. 

ISLMID: MID2208 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2208 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2208 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2208 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2208 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2208 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2208 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2208 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2208 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2208 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID145 

TERRMID: MID145 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID145 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID145 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID145 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID145 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID145 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID145 involved naval shelling, but was not connected to any maritime claims. See CIVWARMID. 

ISLMID: MID145 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID145 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID145 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID145 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID145 from cm narrative, this is a naval incident involving US and UK vs. China that occurred February and March 1927. China had been divided along Communist and KMT (led by Chiang Kai-Shek, an anti-communist) fighting for years and would continue until 1949 as the Chinese Civil War. This MID occurred when fighting broke out in Shanghai and Nanking, causing US and UK naval and ground forces to be increased at those locations, and some shelling of Chinese territory occurred to protect US and UK interests. Coded civil war MID because militarized factions in China broke out into fighting, threatening US and UK interests and causing those countries to threaten and use force against China, triggering this MID. 

CIVWARLINK: MID145 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID145 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID145 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID145 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID145 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID145 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID633 

TERRMID: MID633 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID633 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID633 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID633 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID633 after the Chinese Civil War ended in 1949, two separate states emerged. The US and its allies recognized the ROC in Taiwan as the true government of China, while the USSR and its allies recognized the PRC that occupied mainland China. After 1949, these disputes changed from purely civil war to also include territorial claims, since the communists (PRC) and nationalists (ROC) occupied separate pieces of territory and were recognized (separately) as governments by various states. Coded third party link to territorial MID because this MID was driven by the tensions between China and Taiwan, who contested the territory of China, and was also driven by the Korean War. The US supported South Vietnam and Taiwan, both of whom were opponents of China and both of whom had territorial disputes here. 

MARITMID: MID633 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID633 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID633 Taiwan and China disputed maritime boundaries as well. Both claimed each other's territorial waters as part of their dispute, and they had conflicting claims in the South China Sea. Coded not maritime because The US and China had no dispute here, although the US was linked to the maritime dispute in its support for Taiwan. 

ISLMID: MID633 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID633 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: MID633 Taiwan and China disputed the ownership of several islands, some off the coast of each country and some in the South China Sea, as part of their dispute. Coded not islands because the US and China did not dispute islands, although the US was linked to the islands dispute through its support for Taiwan. 

CIVWARMID: MID633 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID633 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID633 from cm narrative, the US deployed warships to the Taiwan Strait at the outbreak of the Korean War and remained until 1955. The US supported Taiwan and recognized it as the true government of China until 1979. In the Korean War, the US supported South Korea while China supported the North. Coded civil war MID because while the Chinese Civil War ended in 1949, there were still hostilities occurring between Taiwan and China, and some militarized nationalist groups remained in mainland China, leading to sporadic fighting over the years. The tensions and disputes between the nationalists and communists, both of whom claimed themselves as the true ruler of China, led to US involvement here. Further, a separate civil war dispute, the Korean War, contributed to this MID that put the US on the opposite side of China.

CIVWARLINK: MID633 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID633 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID633 coded civil war link because tensions between China and Taiwan led to this MID, and Taiwan is outside of this dyad. After 1949, the China-Taiwan conflict is characterized along both territorial and civil war dimensions. Separately, the Korean War contributed to this MID, and Korea is outside of this dyad. 

COUPMID: MID633 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID633 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID633 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID633 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID634 

TERRMID: MID634 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID634 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID634 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID634 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID634 after the Chinese Civil War ended in 1949, two separate states emerged. The US and its allies recognized the ROC in Taiwan as the true government of China, while the USSR and its allies recognized the PRC that occupied mainland China. After 1949, these disputes changes from purely civil war to also include territorial claims, since the communists (PRC) and nationalists (ROC) occupied separate pieces of territory and were recognized (separately) as governments by various states. Coded third party link to territorial MID because this MID was driven by the tensions between China and Taiwan, who contested the territory of China, and these tensions led to this MID. 

MARITMID: MID634 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID634 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID634 Taiwan and China disputed maritime boundaries as well. Both claimed each other's territorial waters as part of their dispute, and they had conflicting claims in the South China Sea. Coded not maritime because The US and China had no dispute here, although the US was linked to the maritime dispute in its support for Taiwan. 

ISLMID: MID634 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID634 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: MID634 Taiwan and China disputed the ownership of several islands, some off the coast of each country and some in the South China Sea, as part of their dispute. Coded not islands because the US and China did not dispute islands, although the US was linked to the islands dispute through its support for Taiwan. 

CIVWARMID: MID634 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID634 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID634 from cm narrative, this MID occurred 10/1/1949-1/24/1950 and was connected to the fallout from the end of the Chinese Civil War. Marines were sent to Shanghai to aid in the evacuation of Americans after the communists seized power in 1949. Coded civil war MID because the US troop presence here was the immediate product of the outcome of the Chinese Civil War, triggering this MID. Hostilities between Taiwan, who the US supported, and China continued after 1949. 

CIVWARLINK: MID634 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID634 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID634 although Taiwan is not directly involved in the events of this MID, this is coded civil war link because the tensions between China and Taiwan led to this MID. After 1949, China-Taiwan is characterized along both territorial and civil war dimensions. 

COUPMID: MID634 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID634 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID634 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID634 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID51 

TERRMID: MID51 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID51 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID51 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID51 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID51 from cm narrative, this MID is the Korean War. The US fought along with the South Koreans, and China fought along with the North Koreans. North and South Korea were engaged in a territorial dispute in the Korean War, and China's and US's opposing support led them to fight directly, triggering this MID between them. Coded third party link to territorial MID because the territorial dispute in Korea led these countries to be involved in this MID. 

MARITMID: MID51 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID51 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID51 the Korean War involved the disputation of maritime boundaries between North and South Korea as well, since each side claimed the entirety of each other's territory. Coded not maritime because China and US did not dispute a maritime boundary here, although they are linked to the maritime element of the dispute. 

ISLMID: MID51 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID51 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: MID51 the Korean War involved the disputation of islands off the coast of the Korean Peninsula as well, since each side claimed the entirety of each other's territory. Coded not islands because the US and China were not disputing islands here, but they were linked to the islands element of the Korean dispute here. 

CIVWARMID: MID51 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID51 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID51 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID51 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID51 coded civil war link because the Korean War has a civil war element. Like China, Korea was divided along communist vs nationalist lines, and these two groups eventually fought the Korean War. That war is considered a civil war since the primary disputants were Koreans, and the peninsula was not divided into two states until after WWII, when it also becomes a territorial dispute. North and South Korea claim the entirety of each other's territory and see the opposing regime essentially as a militarized group illegitimately controlling part of the peninsula. Coded civil war link because the Korean civil war is outside of this dyad, and the US and China fought here due to their opposing support in that war. 

COUPMID: MID51 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID51 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID51 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID51 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2052 

TERRMID: MID2052 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2052 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2052 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID2052 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID2052 from cm narrative, this is similar to MID633 in that the US and Taiwan deployed warships to the Strait of Taiwan as a deterrent threat to China after the 1949 civil war ended. Following that civil war, the US recognized Taiwan as the government of China, while others, including USSR, recognized PRC, or China, as the true government. Thus, after the 1949 civil war, there are two separate recognized states involved in a territorial dispute. Coded third party link to territorial MID because this MID was driven by the tensions between China and Taiwan, who contested the territory of China, and these tensions led to this MID. 

MARITMID: MID2052 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2052 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2052 Taiwan and China disputed maritime boundaries as well. Both claimed each other's territorial waters as part of their dispute, and they had conflicting claims in the South China Sea. Coded not maritime because The US and China had no dispute here, although the US was linked to the maritime dispute in its support for Taiwan. 

ISLMID: MID2052 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2052 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: MID2052 Taiwan and China disputed the ownership of several islands, some off the coast of each country and some in the South China Sea, as part of their dispute. Coded not islands because the US and China did not dispute islands, although the US was linked to the islands dispute through its support for Taiwan. 

CIVWARMID: MID2052 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2052 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID2052 from cm narrative, this is a multilateral MID that occurred 2/16/1951-10/16/1952, and is similar to the events of MID633. The US and Taiwan deployed warships to the Strait of Taiwan after the Chinese Civil War, and these activities between Taiwan and China are an example of civil war activities that continued after the Chinese Civil War ended in 1949, as both countries claimed to be China and the rightful owner of all Chinese territory. Coded civil war MID because the civil war related dispute between China and Taiwan brought the US into this dispute via its support of Taiwan's claim (civil war within this dyad). 

CIVWARLINK: MID2052 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2052 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID2052 is a multilateral MID appearing as a civil war MID in the China-Taiwan dyad. Coded civil war link because this MID involves civil conflict connected to Taiwan, outside of this dyad. 

COUPMID: MID2052 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2052 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2052 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2052 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID50 

TERRMID: MID50 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID50 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID50 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID50 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID50 is a multilateral dispute involving China and the USSR v. the US, South Korea and Taiwan. From cm narrative, the Chinese charged U.S. planes had violated Manchurian air space. The dispute was a part of the larger China-Taiwan conflict. Coded third party link to territory because the US, South Korea, and Taiwan were on opposite sides of the China-Taiwan territorial dispute from China and USSR, and the tensions from that territorial dispute drove the events of this MID.

MARITMID: MID50 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID50 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID50 Taiwan and China disputed maritime boundaries as well. Both claimed each other's territorial waters as part of their dispute, and they had conflicting claims in the South China Sea. Coded not maritime because The US and China had no dispute here, although the US was linked to the maritime dispute in its support for Taiwan. 

ISLMID: MID50 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID50 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: MID50 Taiwan and China disputed the ownership of several islands, some off the coast of each country and some in the South China Sea, as part of their dispute. Coded not islands because the US and China did not dispute islands, although the US was linked to the islands dispute through its support for Taiwan. 

CIVWARMID: MID50 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID50 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID50 Taiwan and China were disputing territory and were distinct states, but this is also considered a civil war MID because each claimed to be the government of China and claimed the entirety of Chinese territory. Neither considered the other to be a separate state. 

CIVWARLINK: MID50 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID50 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID50 is a multilateral MID appearing as a civil war MID in the China-Taiwan dyad. Coded civil war link because this MID involves civil conflict connected to Taiwan, outside of this dyad. 

COUPMID: MID50 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID50 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID50 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID50 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2035 

TERRMID: MID2035 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2035 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2035 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID2035 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID2035 from cm narrative, this MID occurred during August of 1953. There was a series of disputes concerning the repatriation of prisoners from the Korean War between August 6 and September 6, 1953. The US is pulled into this dispute due to its participation in the Korean War, which included fighting against China. Coded third party link to territorial MID because the Korean War was territorial in nature, China and the US were connected to that war, and the hostilities in this MID are connected to the Korean War. 

MARITMID: MID2035 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2035 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2035 North and South Korea disputed maritime boundaries as well. Both claimed each other's territorial waters as part of their dispute. Coded not maritime because The US and China had no dispute here, although the US was linked to the maritime dispute in its support for South Korea. 

ISLMID: MID2035 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2035 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: MID2035 North and South Korea disputed the ownership of several islands as part of their dispute. Coded not islands because the US and China did not dispute islands, although the US was linked to the islands dispute through its support for South Korea. 

CIVWARMID: MID2035 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2035 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID2035 civil war outside of this dyad. See CIVWARLINK. 

CIVWARLINK: MID2035 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2035 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID2035 North and South Korea's dispute is also considered a civil war MID because each claimed to be the government of Korea and claimed the entirety of Korean territory. Korea was divided along nationalist vs. communist lines, similar to the Chinese Civil War. Coded civil war link because the Korean War is outside this dyad and contributed to this MID between China and US. 

COUPMID: MID2035 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2035 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2035 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2035 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2033 

TERRMID: MID2033 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2033 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2033 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2033 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID2033 the US and China had previous disputes due to US support for Taiwan, but this dispute is related to US vessels searching for survivors of a downed passenger airplane. Not connected to China-Taiwan territorial dispute. 

MARITMID: MID2033 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2033 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2033 from cm narrative, MID2033 occurred in July of 1954. In July of 1954, the Chinese shot down a British airliner. Following the downing of the airliner, a U.S. carrier group confronted the Chinese while looking for survivors, triggering this MID. Coded not maritime because the US and China were not disputing a maritime boundary. 

ISLMID: MID2033 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2033 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2033 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2033 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2033 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2033 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2033 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2033 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2033 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2033 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2032 

TERRMID: MID2032 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2032 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2032 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID2032 2 -- somewhat certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID2032 from cm narrative, the US and China exchanged aircraft fire over the ocean near North Korea on 5/11/1955. This is a bilateral MID. Coded third party link to territorial because the US and China were opposed over the Korea dispute. The US was supporting South Korea, and China was supporting North Korea. The US and China had fought in direct, intense warfare in the Korean War. Coded somewhat certain because there is no direct evidence of what caused this dispute, but the US presence near Korea and the clash near North Korea, along with the recency of the fighting between US and China over Korea, suggests that this is tied to the Korean War. 

MARITMID: MID2032 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2032 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2032 Taiwan and China disputed maritime boundaries as well. Both claimed each other's territorial waters as part of their dispute, and they had conflicting claims in the South China Sea. Coded not maritime because The US and China had no dispute here, although the US was linked to the maritime dispute in its support for Taiwan. 

ISLMID: MID2032 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2032 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: MID2032 Taiwan and China disputed the ownership of several islands, some off the coast of each country and some in the South China Sea, as part of their dispute. Coded not islands because the US and China did not dispute islands, although the US was linked to the islands dispute through its support for Taiwan. 

CIVWARMID: MID2032 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2032 2 -- somewhat certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID2032 coded somewhat certain because while there is no direct indication that this dispute was connected to US support for the Korea dispute, which has a civil war element, it is unclear exactly what led to this dispute. It is likely that the US and China clashed over the Korea dispute here since they had fought against each other recently in the Korean War, and the clash occurred near Korea. The US regularly kept a presence near the peninsula as a form of support for South Korea. 

CIVWARLINK: MID2032 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2032 2 -- somewhat certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID2032 coded somewhat certain because while there is no direct indication that this MID was connected to the Taiwan dispute, it is likely that the US-China tensions over Korea contributed to this MID, and South Korea is outside of this dyad. 

COUPMID: MID2032 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2032 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2032 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2032 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID53 

TERRMID: MID53 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID53 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID53 1 -- third party link to territorial MID 
TERRLINK-CER: MID53 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID53 from cm narrative, this MID occurred August 22-23, 1956. Chinese aircraft shot down a U.S. patrol aircraft off the Chinese coast. U.S. ships entered the area to search for survivors. The Chinese stated that the aircraft was mistaken for a Nationalist plane. Coded third party link to territorial MID because per China's admission, the US plane was shot down due to China's territorial dispute with Taiwan, as China apparently believed it was shooting at a Taiwanese plane. 

MARITMID: MID53 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID53 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID53 Taiwan and China disputed maritime boundaries as well. Both claimed each other's territorial waters as part of their dispute, and they had conflicting claims in the South China Sea. Coded not maritime because The US and China had no dispute here, although the US was linked to the maritime dispute in its support for Taiwan. 

ISLMID: MID53 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID53 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: MID53 Taiwan and China disputed the ownership of several islands, some off the coast of each country and some in the South China Sea, as part of their dispute. Coded not islands because the US and China did not dispute islands, although the US was linked to the islands dispute through its support for Taiwan. 

CIVWARMID: MID53 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID53 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID53 from cm narrative, this MID occurred August 22-23, 1956. Chinese aircraft shot down a U.S. patrol aircraft off the Chinese coast. U.S. ships entered the area to search for survivors. The Chinese stated that the aircraft was mistaken for a Nationalist plane. Coded civil war MID because per China's admission, the US place was shot down due to China's dispute with Taiwan, which has a civil war element. China and Taiwan, though separate states at this point, did not consider each other to be a separate state, viewed themselves as the legitimate government of China, and viewed the other as a Chinese group illegitimately controlling Chinese territory. 

CIVWARLINK: MID53 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID53 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID53 this MID occurred due to tensions between China and Taiwan. The China-Taiwan dispute has a civil war element, and this is coded civil war link because the civil conflict is also present outside of this dyad (Taiwan). 

COUPMID: MID53 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID53 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID53 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID53 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2049 

TERRMID: MID2049 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2049 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2049 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID2049 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID2049 from cm narrative, this MID occurred June 12-13, 1957. This dispute was part of the larger China-Taiwan conflict. Four carriers were sent by the US following the shelling of Kinmen island in July 1957. Coded third party link to territorial MID because this was connected to the US support for Taiwan in the China-Taiwan territorial dispute. 

MARITMID: MID2049 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2049 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2049 Taiwan and China disputed maritime boundaries as well. Both claimed each other's territorial waters as part of their dispute, and they had conflicting claims in the South China Sea. Coded not maritime because The US and China had no dispute here, although the US was linked to the maritime dispute in its support for Taiwan. 

ISLMID: MID2049 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2049 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: MID2049 Taiwan and China disputed the ownership of several islands, some off the coast of each country and some in the South China Sea, as part of their dispute. Coded not islands because the US and China did not dispute islands, although the US was linked to the islands dispute through its support for Taiwan. 

CIVWARMID: MID2049 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2049 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID2049 from cm narrative, this MID occurred June 12-13, 1957. This dispute was part of the larger China-Taiwan conflict. Four carriers were sent by the US following the shelling of Kinmen island in July 1957. Coded third party link to territorial MID because this was connected to the US support for Taiwan in the China-Taiwan dispute, which has a civil war element. 

CIVWARLINK: MID2049 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2049 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID2049 is connected to the China-Taiwan dispute, which is partly civil conflict in nature. Coded civil war link because civil conflict element is present in Taiwan, outside of this dyad. 

COUPMID: MID2049 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2049 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2049 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2049 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID173 

TERRMID: MID173 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID173 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID173 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID173 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID173 from cm narrative, this MID was part of the China-Taiwan conflict and occurred from July through December of 1958. This incident involved the shelling of Quemoy-Matsu by the PRC. The United States intervened and escorted Taiwanese ships in the area. Coded third party link to territorial MID because the US and China are in this MID due to US's support for Taiwan in the China-Taiwan territorial dispute. 

MARITMID: MID173 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID173 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID173 Taiwan and China disputed maritime boundaries as well. Both claimed each other's territorial waters as part of their dispute, and they had conflicting claims in the South China Sea. Coded not maritime because The US and China had no dispute here, although the US was linked to the maritime dispute in its support for Taiwan. 

ISLMID: MID173 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID173 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: MID173 Taiwan and China disputed the ownership of several islands, some off the coast of each country and some in the South China Sea, as part of their dispute. Coded not islands because the US and China did not dispute islands, although the US was linked to the islands dispute through its support for Taiwan. 

CIVWARMID: MID173 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID173 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID173 MID173 from cm narrative, this MID was part of the China-Taiwan conflict and occurred from July through December of 1958. This incident involved the shelling of Quemoy-Matsu by the PRC. The United States intervened and escorted Taiwanese ships in the area. Coded civil war because the US and China are in this MID due to US's support for Taiwan in the China-Taiwan dispute, which has a civil war element. 

CIVWARLINK: MID173 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID173 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID173 this MID occurred due to tensions between China and Taiwan. The China-Taiwan dispute has a civil war element, and this is coded civil war link because the civil conflict is also present outside of this dyad (Taiwan).

COUPMID: MID173 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID173 1 -- certain

MID2002 

TERRMID: MID2002 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2002 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2002 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2002 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID2002 from cm narrative, this MID occurred 5/27/1960 and was triggered when China complained that there had been at least three U-2 over flights violating their territory. These charges were made during the UN debate over the Soviet downing of an American U-2. Coded not third party link to territory because this was not connected to the China-Taiwan dispute, but rather occurred as the US was protesting USSR shooting down one of its aircraft. China appears to have been supporting USSR by claiming that the US had also been flying recon missions over its territory, implying that the downing of the U-2 was justified. 

MARITMID: MID2002 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2002 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2002 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2002 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2002 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2002 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID2002 not connected to the Taiwan-China dispute. 

CIVWARLINK: MID2002 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2002 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2002 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2002 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2002 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2002 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID1363 

TERRMID: MID1363 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID1363 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID1363 from cm narrative, this MID is about the internationalized Laotian Civil War. The US and Thailand were supporting the Royal Laotian Government (incumbent), and the USSR, China, and North Vietnam were supporting the communist guerrillas (militarized rebel group). The US and USSR did not want that conflict to lead to a direct conflict between US and USSR, and there was a push to resolve the conflict via a Geneva Conference. China warned that it would intervene with direct military force if SEATO intervened. This threat constitutes MID1363. Coded not territorial because neither the US nor China were advancing a territorial claim here.

TERRLINK: MID1363 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID1363 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID1363 this is an internationalized civil war in which several countries supported the rebels or the regimes, but none of these countries were making a claim on Laotian territory. The Laotian conflict is purely civil war in nature. 

MARITMID: MID1363 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID1363 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID1363 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID1363 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID1363 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID1363 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID1363 coded not civil war because the civil war in Laos is outside of this dyad. See CIVWARLINK. 

CIVWARLINK: MID1363 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID1363 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID1363 from cm narrative, this MID was an internationalized Laotian Civil War. The US and China supported opposite sides in the war. A threat by China, who was supporting the communist guerrillas, triggered this multilateral MID. Coded civil war link because the Laotian Civil War is outside of this dyad and caused a MID between US and China here. 

COUPMID: MID1363 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID1363 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID1363 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID1363 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID3361 

TERRMID: MID3361 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID3361 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID3361 from cm narrative, this is a multilateral MID in which China and the USSR threatened that the US was provoking war by building up its forces in South Vietnam. China and USSR were supporting North Vietnam. Coded not territory because the US and China were not disputing territory here. See TERRLINK.

TERRLINK: MID3361 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID3361 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID3361 from cm narrative, the US's support of South Vietnam, and China and USSR's support of North Vietnam triggered this MID. The Vietnam War is a territorial MID because each was trying to control the entire territory of Vietnam. Coded third party link to territory because Vietnam War is a territorial MID and the US and China's opposing support triggered this MID.

MARITMID: MID3361 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID3361 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID3361 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3361 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3361 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3361 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID3361 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3361 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID3361 the Vietnam War is also considered a civil war MID because North Vietnamese communist guerrillas were present in the South, fighting against the government as part of the war effort, and China and USSR were supporting these guerillas. Coded civil war link because this MID has a civil war element between North and South Vietnam, and US and China's opposing support triggered this MID. 

COUPMID: MID3361 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID3361 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3361 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3361 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID1353 

TERRMID: MID1353 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID1353 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID1353 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID1353 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID1353 this is connected to the Laotian Civil War, and China and US's opposing support. That conflict did not have a territorial dispute element; it was purely civil war in nature. See CIVWARLINK.

MARITMID: MID1353 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID1353 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID1353 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID1353 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID1353 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID1353 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID1353 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID1353 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID1353 from cm narrative, this is related to the Laotian Civil War that takes place from 1963 to 1973. China directly supported the Pathet Lao communist insurgency and conducted military operations in northern Laos, and the USSR provided less direct support to communist insurgents. The US supported the Royal Laotian Government (RLG) forces. Chinese forces directly engaged in combat with RLG forces, triggering this MID due to the US support for RLG forces and China's support for communist forces. Coded civil war link because the civil war in Laos is outside of this dyad and led to this MID. 

COUPMID: MID1353 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID1353 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID1353 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID1353 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID172 

TERRMID: MID172 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID172 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID172 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID172 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID172 occurred February 25-December 19, 1962. From cm narrative, this dispute is part of the China-Taiwan conflict. This dispute is a border violation involving Taiwan and China, and the US is pulled in due to its support for Taiwan. Coded third party link to territory because US support for Taiwan pulls them into this territorial MID between Taiwan and China. 

MARITMID: MID172 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID172 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID172 Taiwan and China disputed maritime boundaries as well. Both claimed each other's territorial waters as part of their dispute, and they had conflicting claims in the South China Sea. Coded not maritime because The US and China had no dispute here, although the US was linked to the maritime dispute in its support for Taiwan. 

ISLMID: MID172 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID172 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: MID172 Taiwan and China disputed the ownership of several islands, some off the coast of each country and some in the South China Sea, as part of their dispute. Coded not islands because the US and China did not dispute islands, although the US was linked to the islands dispute through its support for Taiwan. 

CIVWARMID: MID172 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID172 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID172 from cm narrative, this MID involved a border violation in the Taiwan-China dispute, which has a civil war element. Coded civil war MID because the civil war activity is within this dyad. 

CIVWARLINK: MID172 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID172 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID172 this MID occurred due to tensions between China and Taiwan. The China-Taiwan dispute has a civil war element, and this is coded civil war link because the civil conflict is also present outside of this dyad (Taiwan).

MID611 

TERRMID: MID611 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID611 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID611 from cm narrative, this is the Vietnam War. The US was supporting South Vietnam, and China and USSR were supporting North Vietnam and communist guerrillas in South Vietnam. Coded not territorial because the US and China were not disputing territory between themselves, but were supporting opposite sides in a territorial dispute. See TERRLINK. 

TERRLINK: MID611 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID611 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID611 from cm narrative, this MID is triggered by the opposing support in the Vietnam War, with the US supporting South Vietnam, and China and USSR supporting North Vietnam and communist insurgents who were fighting in the South. Coded third party link to territory because North Vietnam and South Vietnam were in a territorial dispute, and the US and China's opposing support triggered this MID between them. 

MARITMID: MID611 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID611 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID611 the North/South Vietnam dispute had implications for maritime boundaries as well, since each claimed the entirety of the other's territory. Coded not maritime because the US and China did not dispute a maritime boundary here, although they were linked to the maritime element of the Vietnam War in their opposing support. 

ISLMID: MID611 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID611 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID611 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID611 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID611 this MID is the Vietnam War, which has a civil war element, but coded not civil war because the civil war is outside of this dyad. See CIVWARLINK.

CIVWARLINK: MID611 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID611 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID611 the Vietnam War is also considered a civil war MID because it involved communist insurgents in South Vietnam fighting against the government and against US forces. Coded civil war link because the civil war is outside of this dyad and contributed to this MID between US and China.

COUPMID: MID611 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID611 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID611 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID611 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID251 

TERRMID: MID251 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID251 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID251 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID251 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID251 occurred April 9, 1965. From cm narrative, this was a clash between US and Chinese aircraft over or near Hainan Island on this date. China and Taiwan dispute the ownership of some of the Hainan Islands in the South China Sea, and this is connected to the overall territorial dispute between these two countries (Each claims the entirety of the other's territory). Coded third party link to territory because this MID is an islands MID between China and Taiwan, and is also a territorial MID since the disputation of the islands is a part of the overall territorial dispute between the two countries. The US is brought into this MID due to its support of Taiwan. 

MARITMID: MID251 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID251 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID251 occurred April 9, 1965. From cm narrative, this was a clash between US and Chinese aircraft over or near Hainan Island on this date. Some of the Hainan Islands are disputed between China and Taiwan due to the maritime boundary implications that involve ownership of the islands. This is part of the South China Sea dispute. Coded not maritime because the US is not a party to this maritime dispute. The clash here is linked to the China-Taiwan disputation of this maritime boundary. 

ISLMID: MID251 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID251 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: MID251 occurred April 9, 1965. From cm narrative, this was a clash between US and Chinese aircraft over or near Hainan Island on this date. Coded not islands because while some of the Hainan Islands are disputed between Taiwan and China, the US is not a party to this dispute. The clash here is linked to the China-Taiwan disputation of these islands. 

CIVWARMID: MID251 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID251 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID251 from cm narrative, this is connected to the Taiwan-China dispute, which has a civil war element.

CIVWARLINK: MID251 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID251 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID251 this MID occurred due to tensions between China and Taiwan. The China-Taiwan dispute has a civil war element, and this is coded civil war link because the civil conflict is also present outside of this dyad (Taiwan).

COUPMID: MID251 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID251 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID251 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID251 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2929 

TERRMID: MID2929 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2929 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2929 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID2929 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID2929 from cm narrative, this MID is a raid initiated by the United States against China, October 5, 1965-November 23, 1967. Jones (1980, 156-73) notes many incidents in which American aircraft strayed over southern China during the air war against North Vietnam. Coded third party link to territory because this MID was driven by US and China's support for opposite sides in the Vietnam War, which was a territorial dispute. 

MARITMID: MID2929 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2929 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2929 coded not maritime because the US and China did not dispute a maritime boundary here, although they are linked to the maritime element of the Vietnam War here, as this raid was connected to the opposing support in the Vietnam War. 

ISLMID: MID2929 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2929 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2929 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2929 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2929 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2929 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID2929 from cm narrative, this MID was connected to the US and China's support for opposite sides in the Vietnam War. China supported the communists in the North and communist guerrillas fighting in South Vietnam, while the US supported South Vietnam. Coded civil war link because the Vietnam War has a civil war element and that civil war is outside of this dyad. 

COUPMID: MID2929 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2929 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2929 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2929 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID1216

TERRMID: MID1216 3 -- not territory
TERRMID-CER: MID1216 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID1216 from cm narrative, this is a multilateral MID involving China/Cambodia/North Vietnam on one side and Thailand/South Vietnam/USA on the other. Cambodian Prince Sihanouk anticipated a North Vietnamese victory in the civil war and broke off relations with the South. He allowed N Vietnamese communist insurgents to set up bases in Cambodia along the border with S Vietnam. Coded not territorial because not related to a territorial claim between US and China. 

TERRLINK: MID1216 1 -- third party linked to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID1216 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID1216 was a multilateral dispute involving China/Cambodia/North Vietnam on one side and Thailand/South Vietnam/USA on the other. Cambodia's Prince Sihanouk decided to compromise with communists when he perceived that they would eventually win the Vietnam War. He allowed North Vietnamese communists to set up bases along the order with S Vietnam, prompting the US, Thailand, and South Vietnam to make incursions into Cambodia to pursue the guerillas. Coded link to territorial dispute because this MID is directly connected to the Vietnam War, a territorial dispute that led to the US and China having a dispute here. 

MARITMID: MID1216 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID1216 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID1216 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID1216 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID1216 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID1216 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID1216 this MID is connected to a civil war lying entirely outside of this dyad. See CIVWARLINK.

CIVWARLINK: MID1216 1 -- civil war link
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID1216 1 -- certain
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID1216 from cm narrative, Cambodia allowed communist rebels to set up bases within Cambodia along the border with S Vietnam. US and South Vietnamese forces later crossed into Cambodia to pursue these rebels, who were fighting against the South and later assisted in the Cambodian Civil War. China and the US were supporting opposite sides in the war, pulling them into this MID against each other. 

COUPMID: MID1216 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID1216 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID1216 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID1216 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID1806 

TERRMID: MID1806 3 -- not territory
TERRMID-CER: MID1806 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID1806 1 -- third party linked to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID1806 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID1806 from cm narrative, US and South Vietnamese troops crossed into Cambodian territory to pursue communist rebels. This action and the resulting clashes were due to the Vietnam War, a territorial dispute between N Vietnam and S Vietnam. Coded third party link to territorial MID because China and US's opposing support in the Vietnam War brings each into this MID. 

MARITMID: MID1806 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID1806 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES:

ISLMID: MID1806 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID1806 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID1806 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID1806 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARLINK: MID1806 1 -- civil war link
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID1806 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID1806 is connected to the Vietnam War, which has a civil war element. China supported the communists in the North and communist guerrillas fighting in South Vietnam, while the US was supporting South Vietnam. Coded civil war link because the Vietnam War is outside of this dyad. 

COUPMID: MID1806 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID1806 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID1806 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID1806 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2936 

TERRMID: MID2936 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2936 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2936 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID2936 2 -- somewhat certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID2936 occurred September 19-October 4, 1969. From cm narrative, this was a raid involving the United States and China. Coded somewhat certain because there is not much specific information about this dispute, only that the raid occurred on this date, but a previous MID (MID2929) occurred when the US similarly conducted an air raid against China, and that was connected to China's support for North Vietnam during the Vietnam War. Jones (1980) notes that the US conducted air raids against China numerous times during the Vietnam War, and this appears to be consistent with that US policy. 

MARITMID: MID2936 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2936 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2936 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2936 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2936 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2936 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2936 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2936 2 -- somewhat certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID2936 coded somewhat certain because the cause of this MID is not certain but appears to be connected to US policy of air raids against China during the Vietnam War, which has a civil war element.

COUPMID: MID2936 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2936 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2936 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2936 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2947 

TERRMID: MID2947 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2947 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2947 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2947 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID2947 the South Vietnam invasion of Laos was not tied to territorial claims, but rather to an attempt by the South to destroy Laotian infrastructure as part of its war against the North. See CIVWARLINK.

MARITMID: MID2947 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2947 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2947 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2947 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2947 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2947 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2947 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2947 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID2947 from cm narrative, this MID occurred 2/9/1971-3/9/1971. China protested that a US airplane violated its airspace, but neither side fired any shots. From US Army Center of Military History (Nguyen 1979: v), the US was supporting a South Vietnamese invasion of Laos in Operation Lam Son 719. South Vietnam invaded to destroy Laotian infrastructure that was designed to assist North Vietnamese communists conduct operations across the border against South Vietnam. The US supported but did not directly participate in the invasion. Coded civil war link because this is tied to the Vietnam War, and South and North Vietnam are outside of this dyad. 

COUPMID: MID2947 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2947 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2947 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2947 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID2948 

TERRMID: MID2948 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2948 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2948 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2948 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2948 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2948 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2948 from cm narrative, this MID occurred in August 1972, after the process of rapprochement began between China and US. China protested that a US aircraft attacked a lifeboat from a Chinese merchant vessel, killing several crew members. No escalation occurred. Coded not maritime because these countries were not disputing a maritime boundary and this was an isolated incident during a period of rapprochement. 

ISLMID: MID2948 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2948 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2948 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2948 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2948 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2948 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2948 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2948 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2948 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2948 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID4065 

TERRMID: MID4065 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID4065 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID4065 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID4065 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID4065 from cm narrative, this MID is connected to the North-South Korea territorial dispute. China supported North Korea and the US supported South Korea in the dispute. China conducted military exercises on the Korean peninsula and claimed that the exercises were a display for the US and South Korea. A short while later, China scrambled jets after the US tracked one of its subs with sonar. Coded third party link to territorial MID because the North-South Korea territorial dispute led to the US and China clashing here due to their opposing support. 

MARITMID: MID4065 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID4065 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID4065 the Korean dispute involved disputation of maritime boundaries as well, since North and South Korea claimed the entirety of each other's territory. Coded not maritime because the US and China did not dispute the maritime boundary here, although they are linked to the maritime dispute through their opposing support. 

ISLMID: MID4065 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4065 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: MID4065 the Korean dispute involved disputation of islands off the coast of the peninsula as well, since North and South Korea claimed the entirety of each other's territory. Coded not islands because the US and China did not dispute islands here, although they are linked to the islands dispute through their opposing support. 

CIVWARMID: MID4065 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4065 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID4065 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4065 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID4065 the North-South Korea dispute is both territorial and civil war in nature. Each side claims the entirety of the other's territory and views the opposing government as an illegitimate militarized group illegally controlling Korean territory. Similar to the Chinese civil war, the groups emerged on communist vs nationalist lines in Korea, and the peninsula was divided after WWII. Coded civil war link because this multilateral MID is driven by the Korean dispute which is civil war in nature and outside of this dyad. 

COUPMID: MID4065 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID4065 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID4065 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID4065 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID4064 

TERRMID: MID4064 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID4064 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID4064 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID4064 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID4064 from cm narrative, this MID is connected to Chinese attempts to intimidate Taiwan from declaring independence and Taiwanese and US responses to Chinese aggression. China deployed missiles, intercepted Taiwanese vessels, conducted military exercises, and conducted naval and air shows of force. In response, Taiwan repeatedly placed its forces on alert, deployed missiles, and scrambled jets. Beginning in 12/95, the US deployed naval forces to the area as a show of force to China. American naval forces were sent to the region again in March 1996. Coded third party link to territory because the US and China involvement here comes from US support for Taiwan in the China-Taiwan territorial dispute. 

MARITMID: MID4064 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID4064 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID4064 Taiwan and China disputed maritime boundaries as well. Both claimed each other's territorial waters as part of their dispute, and they had conflicting claims in the South China Sea. Coded not maritime because The US and China had no dispute here, although the US was linked to the maritime dispute in its support for Taiwan. 

ISLMID: MID4064 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4064 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: MID4064 Taiwan and China disputed the ownership of several islands, some off the coast of each country and some in the South China Sea, as part of their dispute. Coded not islands because the US and China did not dispute islands, although the US was linked to the islands dispute through its support for Taiwan. 

CIVWARMID: MID4064 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4064 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID4064 from cm narrative, this is connected to the China-Taiwan dispute which has a civil war element, and China and US clash due to US support for Taiwan in the dispute. 

CIVWARLINK: MID4064 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4064 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID4064 coded civil war link because this MID is connected to the China-Taiwan dispute, which has a civil war element, and the civil war element is present in Taiwan also, outside of this dyad. 

COUPMID: MID4064 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID4064 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID4064 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID4064 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID4088 

TERRMID: MID4088 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID4088 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID4088 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID4088 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID4088 from cm narrative, this MID is another connected to Chinese aggression to deter Taiwan from declaring independence, and the US and Taiwan's response to the aggression. China conducted a series of alerts, threats, and shows of force aimed at intimidating Taiwan. Taiwan responded to these actions by repeatedly placing its forces on alert and launching its own fighters when China conducted sorties near Taiwan. The US responded to the increased tensions by deploying two aircraft carrier groups to the region in July and August 1999. The threats and shows of force by both sides continued into 2000 (began in July 1999). Coded third party link to territorial MID because the US and China clash due to the US support for Taiwan in the China-Taiwan territorial dispute. 

MARITMID: MID4088 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID4088 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID4088 Taiwan and China disputed maritime boundaries as well. Both claimed each other's territorial waters as part of their dispute, and they had conflicting claims in the South China Sea. Coded not maritime because The US and China had no dispute here, although the US was linked to the maritime dispute in its support for Taiwan. 

ISLMID: MID4088 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4088 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: MID4088 Taiwan and China disputed the ownership of several islands, some off the coast of each country and some in the South China Sea, as part of their dispute. Coded not islands because the US and China did not dispute islands, although the US was linked to the islands dispute through its support for Taiwan. 

CIVWARMID: MID4088 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4088 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: from cm narrative, this is connected to the China-Taiwan dispute which has a civil war element, and China and US clash due to US support for Taiwan in the dispute. 

CIVWARLINK: MID4088 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4088 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID4088 coded civil war link because this MID is connected to the China-Taiwan dispute, which has a civil war element, and the civil war element is also present in Taiwan, outside of this dyad. 

COUPMID: MID4088 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID4088 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID4088 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID4088 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID4336 

TERRMID: MID4336 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID4336 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID4336 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4336 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID4336 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID4336 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID4336 occurred on March 23, 2001. From cm narrative, China chased a US naval vessel out of waters that it claims to be its own, but the maritime boundary is not recognized internationally. However, this is coded not maritime because while the two countries dispute the maritime boundary (the US does not recognize the Chinese position on the boundary), but this was about US attempting to conduct surveillance activities against China. The US was not attempting to challenge the Chinese maritime boundary, and this was an anti-surveillance dispute. 

ISLMID: MID4336 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4336 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID4336 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4336 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4336 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES:

COUPMID-CER: MID4336 1 -- certain

COUPLINK-CER: MID4336 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 



MID4281 

TERRMID: MID4281 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID4281 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID4281 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4281 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID4281 occurred from April through August of 2001. From cm narrative, this dispute consists of 6 incidents in which Chinese threats toward Taiwan escalated to involve shows of force by both sides. The US is pulled into this dispute by threatening force against China if Taiwan is attacked. Coded third party link to territorial MID because this MID between China and US is connected to the China-Taiwan territorial dispute. 

MARITMID: MID4281 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID4281 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID4281 Taiwan and China disputed maritime boundaries as well. Both claimed each other's territorial waters as part of their dispute, and they had conflicting claims in the South China Sea. Coded not maritime because The US and China had no dispute here, although the US was linked to the maritime dispute in its support for Taiwan. 

ISLMID: MID4281 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4281 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: MID4281 Taiwan and China disputed the ownership of several islands, some off the coast of each country and some in the South China Sea, as part of their dispute. Coded not islands because the US and China did not dispute islands, although the US was linked to the islands dispute through its support for Taiwan. 

CIVWARMID: MID4281 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4281 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID4281 from cm narrative, this is connected to the China-Taiwan dispute which has a civil war element, and China and US clash due to US support for Taiwan in the dispute.

CIVWARLINK: MID4281 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4281 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID4281 coded civil war link because this MID is connected to the China-Taiwan dispute, which has a civil war element, and the civil war element is also present in Taiwan, outside of this dyad. 

COUPMID: MID4281 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID4281 1 -- certain

MID4280 

TERRMID: MID4280 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID4280 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID4280 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4280 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID4280 occurred from April through July of 2001. This dispute involves 5 incidents between the US & China that center around American reconnaissance near the Chinese coast. Coded not third party link to territory because unlike many previous MIDs, this was not connected to the China-Taiwan dispute but was rather an issue of the US conducting surveillance against China and Chinese efforts to thwart the surveillance activity. 

MARITMID: MID4280 3 -- not maritime
